item.title: [154] /pcbg/ - PC Building General
item.description:
>UPGRADE & BUILD ADVICE
Post build list or current specs including MONITOR: https://pcpartpicker.com/
Provide specific use cases (e.g. 4K editing, high FPS gaming)
State budget and COUNTRY or you will not be helped

NEWS
>RTX 5060, RX 9060 XT, and Arc B770 expected with Computex

>12VHPWR
If a 12VHPWR connector is not fully seated in its socket, the connection can melt.
Do not use aftermarket cables or adapters.

>Intel Raptor Lake / RPL Refresh
Instability reported with 13th and 14th gen, i5 K SKUs and above (incl non-K). Update BIOS and apply Intel Baseline settings. Avoid purchases.

>CPUS
HTPC(4K60)/Web Browsing: i3 12100T
Gaming: R5 9600X; budget: i5 13400; eXtreme: R7 7800X3D
Multicore: Ultra 7 265K; budget: Ultra 5 235; destitute: i5 13400
>Avoid iGPU-less CPUs
>Existing AM4 board with an old chip? Consider a Zen 3 CPU

>GRAPHICS CARDS (@MSRP)
1080p: RTX 3060 12 GB / RTX 4060; ultra budget: used RTX 2060 Super
1440p: RTX 5070; RT: RTX 5070 Ti
2160p: RTX 5080; budget: RTX 5070 Ti
RX 9070 XT: reasonable if at least 33% cheaper than an RTX 5070 Ti or close to price of RTX 5070
Amateur production: RTX 3060 12GB, RTX 5060 Ti 16GB, used RTX 3090, used RTX 4090, RTX 5090

>RAM
DDR4: Zen3/AM4 - 2x 16GB 3600 MT/s CL18; for locked "non-K" 12th/13th/LGA1700 - 2x 16GB 3200 MT/s CL16
DDR5: Zen4/AM5 - 2x 16GB 6000 MT/s CL30; for Core Ultra/LGA1851 - 2x 16GB 6400MT/s CL32

>COOLERS
Thermalright Phantom Spirit (or variant), Thermaltake Frozen Prism

>PSUS
A new PSU should be ATX 3.1 compliant
Aim for 50-75% PSU utilization at full system load
https://hwbusters.com/best_picks/best-atxv3-pcie5-ready-psus-picks-hardware-busters/

>SSDS
WD SN5000 2 TB, Samsung 990 Pro 2 TB
Avoid: cheapest NVMe SSDs
https://ssd.borecraft.com/

>MOTHERBOARDS
Good power delivery is required for Intel CPUs like the i5 13600K and above
Generally don't pair a K CPU with a B mobo chipset

>GAMING MONITORS
AOC Q27G3XMN, MSI MPG 321URX
https://pcpartpicker.com/user/pcbg/saved/dP3v4D

Prev: >>105211191

Original filename: Screenshot_2021-05-29 ZeptoBars.png

item.title: [178] >In his first interview since 2024, reclusive copy writer Shigesato Itoi has gi
item.description:
>In his first interview since 2024, reclusive copy writer Shigesato Itoi has given a rare interview to Hikaru Katada of Famitsu ostensibly to discuss his career and the drone of modern life.
>When Katada asked about the alarming new study revealing birth rates in Japan have plummeted to an all-time low, Itoi paused, studied the table between them, and then simply pointed at the Katada’s iPhone with a withering expression of pre-apocalyptic clairvoyance.
>“That right there,” Itoi said, according to the piece. “That rectangle is the baby now. It glows. It pings. The adult baby rattler.”
>When pressed further on the game industry’s role in this decline, Itoi responded: “Game companies still believe it’s in the enlightenment business. It’s not. It’s packaging plastic for people who want their shelves to look quirky on Line.”
>In the full interview, the legendary writer also laments the current state of video games, saying most of them now are “just long-form apologies disguised as self-help manuals with a shounen coat.” When asked if he still believes they can change the world, Itoi clarified: “Video games did change the world. This is the result.”

Original filename: Shigesato-Itoi.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 30] AI Pokemon Thread /NAPT/ Thread 184: Enchanting Bellelba Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art, and make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pokemon related gens.

NovelAI is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL·E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‘buzz’ currency. You get about 50 every day plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Tensor is free to use as well, although you are limited to how many gens you can make per day.
>https://tensor.art/

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Hailuo AI takes uploaded art and animates them based on the prompts you get. You get a 3-day free trial, followed by roughly 3 free gens a day afterward. Subscription plans are available.
>https://hailuoai.video/

Pastebin of Pokemon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 300 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pokemon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread:>>57762891

Original filename: 1746721333547095.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 30] /XMR/ Monero General
item.description:
Welcome to the /XMR/ Monero General, dedicated to the discussion of the world's most widely adopted privacy coin.

Monero payments are anonymous, low-fee by design and fully fungible, meaning users can send XMR globally without issue and receive XMR without having to worry about tainted coins. Battle-tested privacy tech (Ring Signatures, Stealth Addresses and RingCT) ensures that critical TX data cannot be gleaned from the Monero blockchain. Thus by default, the TX history of all Monero users is kept hidden from the prying eyes of adversaries, with TXs being optionally transparent via the aid of a view key.

Monero algorithmically ensures low TX fees by employing a dynamic (elastic) block size that can "stretch" to easily accommodate sudden TX spikes.

Monero's bespoke mining algorithm, RandomX, is optimized for devices using general-purpose CPUs e.g. desktops, laptops, smartphones, tablets, keeping the barrier to entry low and ASICs out of the equation.

Monero's tail emission - 0.6 XMR every block forever - financially incentives for-profit miners to keep mining, helping boost long-term network security. This constant linear inflation asymptotically trends to zero and is offset somewhat by a steady rate of coin loss.

Monero has thus far proven to be the only altcoin capable of overcoming BTC's network effect by driving it out of the darknet economy BTC dominated for over 10 years. Monero is now also starting to overtake BTC in clearnet commerce as well. See below.

If you still have questions, feel free to ask and a MoneroChad will be with you shortly.


XMR Redpill: https://yewtu.be/watch?v=wq6w03E2DS4

XMR Resources: https://libereco.xyz/resources/

XMR Stats: moneroj.net

USE XMR: https://cryptwerk.com/pay-with/xmr/

OFFICIAL WEBSITE - getmonero.org

WHERE TO BUY XMR: https://i.imgur.com/XdppsQ7.png
Crypto ATMs: see kycnot.me

>MINING
archive.is/TWOah

HOW TO STORE MONERO?

>Desktop
Official GUI/CLI
Featherwallet

>Mobile
IOS: Cakewallet
Android: Monerujo

Original filename: 1696213276411729.jpg

item.title: [ 35] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Super Saturday - round 10
item.description:
Gameface edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Canberra Raiders v Canterbury Bulldogs
3:00pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
GIO Stadium, Canberra
2.67-2.21
>A top of the table blockbuster kicks off Super Saturday. The Raiders pulled off a dramatic 20-18 win over the Storm last weekend. The Bulldogs also impressed, overcoming a disrupted lineup to defeat the Titans 38-18, despite being without several key players through suspension. Last time the Bulldogs won at GIO Stadium was 10 years ago.
Raiders 1-12 2.85
Raiders 13+ 3.20
Bulldogs 1-12 3.25
Bulldogs 13+ 5.60
Raiders -2.5 1.90 Bulldogs +2.5 1.90

>GAME 2
St George-Illawarra Dragons v New Zealand Warriors
5:30pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
WIN Stadium, Wollongong
2.13-1.72
>2025's surprise packets, Let’s Gone, sit in third as they take on an inconsistent side striving to bounce back to form. The in-form Warriors are eyeing a fourth consecutive win as they travel to Wollongong to face a Dragons side that continues to struggle for consistency. The Dragons suffered a frustrating defeat to the Tigers, undermined by crucial lapses just before half-time. The Warriors impressed in a gritty win over the Cowboys, pushing them up to third on the ladder despite some injury setbacks.
Dragons 1-12 3.30
Dragons 13+ 4.80
Warriors 1-12 2.90
Warriors 13+ 3.50
Dragons +2.5 1.81 Warriors -2.5 2.00

>GAME 3
North Queensland Cowboys v Penrith Panthers
7:35pm AEST on Fox and Kayo
Queensland Country Bank Stadium, Townsville
2.37-1.59
>The Panthers are aiming to build momentum after a season-best showing, while the Cowboys look to repeat their earlier upset over the reigning premiers, this time on home turf. North Queensland suffered a tough loss to the Warriors, continuing their up-and-down campaign. Penrith delivered their most complete performance of the season in Magic Round, thumping the Broncos and climbing off the foot of the ladder.
Cowboys 1-12 3.50
Cowboys 13+ 5.60
Panthers 1-12 2.90
Panthers 13+ 3.00
Cowboys +3.5 1.98 Panthers -3.5 1.83

item.title: [ 93] Midnass
item.description:

item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 56] Luigi was right
item.description:
>The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash [to the shooting] prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/08/unitedhealthcare-sued-by-shareholders-over-reaction-to-ceos-killing.html

A group of investors sued UnitedHealthcare Group

on Wednesday, accusing the company of misleading them after the killing of its CEO, Brian Thompson.

The class action lawsuit — filed in the Southern District of New York — accuses the health insurance company of not initially adjusting their 2025 net earning outlook to factor in how Thompson's killing would affect their operations.

On Dec. 3 — a day before Thompson was fatally shot — the company issued guidance that included net earnings of $28.15 to $28.65 per share and adjusted net earnings of $29.50 to $30.00 per share, the suit notes. And on January 16, the company announced that it was sticking with its old forecast.

The investors described this as "materially false and misleading," pointing to the immense public scrutiny the company and the broader health insurance industry experienced in the wake of Thompson's killing.

The group, which is seeking unspecified damages, argued that the public backlash prevented the company from pursuing "the aggressive, anti-consumer tactics that it would need to achieve" its earnings goals.

"As such, the Company was deliberately reckless in doubling down on its previously issued guidance," the suit reads.

Original filename: file.jpg

item.title: [294] Viv could've had a more interesting story if she portrayed her demons in Helluv
item.description:
Viv could've had a more interesting story if she portrayed her demons in Helluva Boss existing under an oppressive culture that rewards cruelty and cynicism while discouraging sincere affection and love resulting in many hellborn quickly melting in response to genuine empathy like viltrumites. It would have even fit her liberal ideals of fighting against oppressive power structures. I find it notable and odd then that her characters not only rub elbows with those in power so often but that said authority figures are portrayed so sympathetically and benevolently. We still see shades of her wanting to portray Blitzo as a "working class hero" but the narrative she set up is (unsurprisingly) schizophrenic and directionless.
Also Stolas is a shit.

Original filename: nword.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 54] US-UK Trade Deal
item.description:
UK and US announce trade deal to save thousands of British jobs, Starmer says

https://news.sky.com/story/uk-and-us-agree-trade-deal-as-starmer-and-trump-make-announcement-in-live-phone-call-13363710

The UK and US have agreed a trade deal, with Sir Keir Starmer and Donald Trump confirming the announcement during a live televised phone call.

It is the first trade deal agreed after Mr Trump began his second presidential term in January, and after he imposed strict tariffs on countries around the world in April.

Sir Keir said the "first-of-a-kind" deal with the US will save thousands of jobs across the UK, boost British business and protect British industry.

item.title: [116] Why is Dexter's Labs online fanbase smaller than that of Courage and Ed Edd n E
item.description:
Why is Dexter's Labs online fanbase smaller than that of Courage and Ed Edd n Eddy? Dexter always felt like a bigger hit than both of them, at the very least. One could debate with Eds, but it was definitely bigger than Courage and I do think it was more popular than the Eds since even though Eds lasted longer, when both were on the air together, Dexter felt like the bigger hit since for a while it was getting more toys and video games than Ed Edd n Eddy did. Yet, for example, Eds and Courage have over 50,000 members on their subreddit while Dexter only has a thousand

item.title: [117] /cfb/ - Not so fast! edition
item.description:
>Michigan Coach Suspension
Sherrone Moore faces a reported two-game suspension due to the Connor Stalions scandal, missing games against Central Michigan and Nebraska but allowed to coach against Oklahoma.

>Lee Corso’s Retirement
Longtime ESPN College GameDay analyst Lee Corso will retire after Week 1 of the 2025 season, marking the end of an era.

>NCAA Governance Changes Proposed
NCAA President Charlie Baker announced plans for a new governance structure to be released in July, granting individual sports more control over their rules and policies. This aims to give Power 4 conferences greater influence.

>House v. NCAA Settlement Update
A new brief in the House v. NCAA case includes provisions to grandfather in athletes affected by roster cuts for the 2025-26 season, allowing reinstatement at schools' discretion.

>Nico Iamaleava Transfer Drama
Former Tennessee QB Nico Iamaleava’s transfer to UCLA continues to make waves, with Arkansas’ NIL collective seeking a $200K buyout from him and another player.

>Clemson’s Unique Addition
Ian Schieffelin, a basketball player, accepted coach Dabo Swinney’s offer to join Clemson’s football team, forgoing pro basketball for now.

>Transfer Portal Highlights
The spring transfer window closed, but top uncommitted prospects remain, with teams like UNLV and Tulane boosting rosters for playoff hopes.

>Recruiting News
The Class of 2026 five-star recruits are shaping up, with May expected to bring significant commitments.

item.title: [ 88] /tpg/ /rcg/ - Theme Park & Roller Coaster General
item.description:
Disneyland Abu Dhabi Edition

>Last Thread: >>2779327

>What is this thread? Why are there two companies?
Disney parks were initially founded as a way to celebrate the culture and history of America and provide middle class families with a fun-filled immersive experience. While theme parks are the main focus of these threads (and the title of the general) there is also discussion on other roller coasters & rides, as well as the parks themselves and trip planning too. That's where /rcg/ comes in.
>Can I talk about Disney/Universal parks in this thread?
Absolutely! Disney and Universal are currently competing for the Orlando theme park market and beyond! Universal is opening new resorts all around the US and new continents!

Thread Pro Tip: Talk about theme parks!

Park Crowd Tracker:
>https://queue-times.com/en-US/parks

Roller Coaster Database:
>https://rcdb.com/

Amusement Park News Sites:
>https://www.themeparkinsider.com/
>https://www.screamscape.com/
>https://www.coaster101.com/

Disney Park News:
>https://www.wdwnt.com/
>https://www.wdwmagic.com/
>https://www.allears.net
>https://www.mousesteps.com

>News
Disneyland Abu Dhabi announced as Disney's 7th resort and first in Middle East. Miral Group (United Arab Emirates government) will entirely fund and operate the park
https://disneyparksblog.com/disney-experiences/disney-announces-abu-dhabi-theme-park/
Epic Universe officially opens in two weeks, but previews are showing heavy operational issues
https://wdwnt.com/2025/05/breaking-harry-potter-and-the-battle-at-the-ministry-to-temporarily-close-during-final-week-of-epic-universe-previews/
And your local theme parks are probably open for weekends now

item.title: [162] /DE3/ - DALL-E 3 General
item.description:
Last thread: >>105124162

>What is DALL-E 3?
It's a text-to-image generator made by OpenAI.

>Links
https://www.bing.com/images/create
https://designer.microsoft.com/image-creator
https://copilot.microsoft.com/

>Download links for latest Bing and Designer Slop scripts:
https://pastebin.com/raw/bk33MxxG (embed)

>Instructions and download for BIC EDIT script:
https://rentry.org/bicedit

>How does it work on Bing?
In Bing's Image Creator, "boosts" are used to speed up the image creation process, each user starts with 15 boosts. When you use a boost, the AI creates your image quickly. If you run out of boosts, the image waiting time can increase, usually if you refresh the page you can get the picture earlier.

>Prompt Generator
https://tipseason.com/dalle-prompt-generator

item.title: [ 37] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.

item.title: [ 68] Anybody from a third-world country ever (legally) travel to the US?
item.description:
Is it really as hard as it seems? My friend in Colombia is trying to visit the US but it seems unreasonably hard to get a tourist visa. Do they really require an in-person interview at the US embassy in Bogota? He doesn't live anywhere near Bogota, how is that reasonable to expect him to travel all the way to Bogota ? Is there any way around that or can he do the interview over the phone? He's just trying to get a tourist visa, not become an immigrant, so why make him pay for a flight and take extra days off work just for a tourist visa?

And how long does it actually take to get a tourist visa approved? How long in advance does he need to plan the trip?

Original filename: US-visa-1366x768-2187306852.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 61] Buenos Aires Argentina
item.description:
Anyone know of stuff to do in Buenos Aires? I'm going to be there for about a month from mid-April to mid-May and most of that time will be free time.

Things I like: fishing, butterflies, tits, food.

item.title: [ 43] My girlfriend is trying to make me sign up for one of these things but this fee
item.description:
My girlfriend is trying to make me sign up for one of these things but this feels like a complete scam. $300 for a backpacking trip at some park. I've been thinking about signing up for a mountaineering course with AAI and it's like 1.8k for a week and you're actually climbing real mountains miles into the backcountry.
